explanation: The report is correct. Given the provided definition #define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0) the assignment int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields err == 0, so the controlling expression if (err) is invariant (always false). This is not one of the permitted exceptions (not an infinite loop nor the special do-while constant-false case), so it violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. (If LFS_LOCK were conditionally defined to perform real locking in other build configurations, the expression might not be invariant in those builds, but with the supplied definition the violation holds.)
